00062 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00063 #include <ws2tcpip.h>
00064 struct in6_addr addr6;
00065 char addr6str[64];
00066 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00067 uint8_t
00068 issame_ip6addr(struct in6_addr addr1, struct in6_addr addr2)
00069 {
00070  return ((addr1.s6_addr32[0]==addr2.s6_addr32[0]) &&
00071                  (addr1.s6_addr32[1]==addr2.s6_addr32[1]) &&
00072                  (addr1.s6_addr32[2]==addr2.s6_addr32[2]) &&
00073                  (addr1.s6_addr32[3]==addr2.s6_addr32[3]) );
00074 }
00075 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00076 uint8_t
00077 iszero_ip6addr(struct in6_addr addr)
00078 {
00079  return ((addr.s6_addr32[0]==0) &&
00080                  (addr.s6_addr32[1]==0) &&
00081                  (addr.s6_addr32[2]==0) &&
00082                  (addr.s6_addr32[3]==0) );
00083 }
00084 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00085 uint8_t
00086 sprint_ip6addr(struct in6_addr addr, char * result)
00087 {
00088   unsigned char i = 0;
00089   unsigned char zerocnt = 0;
00090   unsigned char numprinted = 0;
00091   char * starting = result;
00092 
00093   *result++='[';
00094   while (numprinted < 8) {
00095     if ((addr.s6_addr16[i] == 0) && (zerocnt == 0)) {
00096       while(addr.s6_addr16[zerocnt + i] == 0) zerocnt++;
00097       if (zerocnt == 1) {
00098         *result++ = '0';
00099          numprinted++;
00100          break;
00101       }
00102       i += zerocnt;
00103       numprinted += zerocnt;
00104     } else {
00105       result += sprintf(result, "%x", (unsigned int) uip_ntohs(addr.s6_addr16[i]));
00106       i++;
00107       numprinted++;
00108     }
00109     if (numprinted != 8) *result++ = ':';
00110   }
00111   *result++=']';
00112   *result=0;
00113   return (result - starting);
00114 }
00115 
00116 #endif /* UIP_CONF_IPV6 */

00121 #endif /* __CYGWIN__ */

00123 struct pcap;
00124 
00125 struct pcap_if {
00126   struct pcap_if *next;
00127   char *name;
00128   char *description;
00129   struct pcap_addr {
00130     struct pcap_addr *next;
00131     struct sockaddr *addr;
00132     struct sockaddr *netmask;
00133     struct sockaddr *broadaddr;
00134     struct sockaddr *dstaddr;
00135   } *addresses;
00136   DWORD flags;
00137 };
00138 
00139 struct pcap_pkthdr {
00140   struct timeval ts;
00141   DWORD caplen;
00142   DWORD len;
00143 };
00144 
00145 HMODULE wpcap;
00146 
00147 static struct pcap *pcap;

00150  * If needed for some purpose it can be defined here
00151  */
00152 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00153 //struct uip_eth_addr uip_ethaddr;
00154 #endif

00157 static struct pcap *(* pcap_open_live)(char *, int, int, int, char *);
00158 static int (* pcap_next_ex)(struct pcap *, struct pcap_pkthdr **, unsigned char **);
00159 static int (* pcap_sendpacket)(struct pcap *, unsigned char *, int);

00203 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00204 static void
00205 error_exit(char *message)
00206 {
00207   printf("error_exit: %s", message);
00208   exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00209 }
00210 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00211 static void
00212 set_ethaddr(struct in_addr addr)
00213 {
00214   PIP_ADAPTER_ADDRESSES adapters;
00215   ULONG size = 0;
00216 
00217   if(GetAdaptersAddresses(AF_INET, GAA_FLAG_SKIP_ANYCAST |
00218                                    GAA_FLAG_SKIP_MULTICAST |
00219                                    GAA_FLAG_SKIP_DNS_SERVER,
00220                           NULL, NULL, &size) != ERROR_BUFFER_OVERFLOW) {
00221     error_exit("error on access to adapter list size\n");
00222   }
00223   adapters = alloca(size);
00224   if(GetAdaptersAddresses(AF_INET, GAA_FLAG_SKIP_ANYCAST |
00225                                    GAA_FLAG_SKIP_MULTICAST |
00226                                    GAA_FLAG_SKIP_DNS_SERVER,
00227                           NULL, adapters, &size) != ERROR_SUCCESS) {
00228     error_exit("error on access to adapter list\n");
00229   }
00230 
00231   while(adapters != NULL) {
00232 
00233     char buffer[256];
00234     WideCharToMultiByte(CP_ACP, 0, adapters->Description, -1,
00235        buffer, sizeof(buffer), NULL, NULL);
00236     log_message("set_ethaddr: found adapter: ", buffer);
00237 
00238     if(adapters->FirstUnicastAddress != NULL &&
00239        adapters->FirstUnicastAddress->Address.lpSockaddr != NULL &&
00240        adapters->FirstUnicastAddress->Address.lpSockaddr->sa_family == AF_INET) {
00241 
00242       struct in_addr adapter_addr;
00243       adapter_addr = ((struct sockaddr_in *)adapters->FirstUnicastAddress->Address.lpSockaddr)->sin_addr;
00244       log_message("set_ethaddr:  with address: ", inet_ntoa(adapter_addr));
00245 
00246       if(adapter_addr.s_addr == addr.s_addr) {
00247         if(adapters->PhysicalAddressLength != 6) {
00248           error_exit("ip addr specified on cmdline does not belong to an ethernet card\n");
00249         }
00250         wsprintf(buffer, "%02X-%02X-%02X-%02X-%02X-%02X",
00251           adapters->PhysicalAddress[0], adapters->PhysicalAddress[1],
00252           adapters->PhysicalAddress[2], adapters->PhysicalAddress[3],
00253           adapters->PhysicalAddress[4], adapters->PhysicalAddress[5]);
00254         log_message("set_ethaddr:  ethernetaddr: ", buffer);
00255 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00256 //      int i;for (i=0;i<6;i++) uip_ethaddr.addr[i] = adapters->PhysicalAddress[i];
00257 #else
00258         uip_setethaddr((*(struct uip_eth_addr *)adapters->PhysicalAddress));
00259 #endif
00260         break;
00261       }
00262     }
00263     adapters = adapters->Next;
00264   }
00265 
00266   if(adapters == NULL) {
00267     error_exit("no adapter found with ip addr specified on cmdline\n");
00268   }
00269 }
00270 
00271 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00272 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00273 static void
00274 set_ethaddr6(struct in_addr6 addr)
00275 {
00276   PIP_ADAPTER_ADDRESSES adapters;
00277   ULONG size = 0;
00278 
00279   if(GetAdaptersAddresses(AF_INET6, GAA_FLAG_SKIP_ANYCAST |
00280                                    GAA_FLAG_SKIP_MULTICAST |
00281                                    GAA_FLAG_SKIP_DNS_SERVER,
00282                           NULL, NULL, &size) != ERROR_BUFFER_OVERFLOW) {
00283     error_exit("error on access to adapter list size\n");
00284   }
00285   adapters = alloca(size);
00286   if(GetAdaptersAddresses(AF_INET6, GAA_FLAG_SKIP_ANYCAST |
00287                                    GAA_FLAG_SKIP_MULTICAST |
00288                                    GAA_FLAG_SKIP_DNS_SERVER,
00289                           NULL, adapters, &size) != ERROR_SUCCESS) {
00290     error_exit("error on access to adapter list\n");
00291   }
00292 
00293   while(adapters != NULL) {
00294 
00295     char buffer[256];
00296     WideCharToMultiByte(CP_ACP, 0, adapters->Description, -1,
00297        buffer, sizeof(buffer), NULL, NULL);
00298     log_message("set_ethaddr: found adapter: ", buffer);
00299 
00300     if(adapters->FirstUnicastAddress != NULL &&
00301        adapters->FirstUnicastAddress->Address.lpSockaddr != NULL &&
00302        adapters->FirstUnicastAddress->Address.lpSockaddr->sa_family == AF_INET6) {
00303 
00304       struct in_addr6 adapter_addr;
00305       adapter_addr = ((struct sockaddr_in6 *)adapters->FirstUnicastAddress->Address.lpSockaddr)->sin6_addr;
00306           sprint_ip6addr(adapter_addr, addr6str);
00307       log_message("set_ethaddr:  with ipv6 address: : ", addr6str);
00308           if(issame_ip6addr(adapter_addr,addr6)) {
00309         if(adapters->PhysicalAddressLength != 6) {
00310           error_exit("ip addr specified on cmdline does not belong to an ethernet card\n");
00311         }
00312         wsprintf(buffer, "%02X-%02X-%02X-%02X-%02X-%02X",
00313           adapters->PhysicalAddress[0], adapters->PhysicalAddress[1],
00314           adapters->PhysicalAddress[2], adapters->PhysicalAddress[3],
00315           adapters->PhysicalAddress[4], adapters->PhysicalAddress[5]);
00316         log_message("set_ethaddr:  ethernetaddr: ", buffer);
00317 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00318 //      int i;for (i=0;i<6;i++) uip_ethaddr.addr[i] = adapters->PhysicalAddress[i]; //does this need doing?
00319 #else
00320         uip_setethaddr((*(struct uip_eth_addr *)adapters->PhysicalAddress));
00321 #endif
00322         break;
00323       }
00324     }
00325     adapters = adapters->Next;
00326   }
00327 
00328   if(adapters == NULL) {
00329     error_exit("no adapter found with ip addr specified on cmdline\n");
00330   }
00331 }
00332 #endif
00333 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00334 static void
00335 init_pcap(struct in_addr addr)
00336 {
00337   struct pcap_if *interfaces;
00338   struct pcap_addr *paddr;
00339   char error[256];
00340  
00341  if(pcap_findalldevs(&interfaces, error) == -1) {
00342     error_exit(error);
00343   }
00344 
00345   while(interfaces != NULL) {
00346     log_message("init_pcap: found interface: ", interfaces->description);
00347 
00348     if(interfaces->addresses != NULL) {
00349       for(paddr = interfaces->addresses;
00350         paddr != NULL;
00351         paddr = paddr->next) {
00352          if(paddr->addr != NULL && paddr->addr->sa_family == AF_INET) {
00353           struct in_addr interface_addr;
00354           interface_addr = ((struct sockaddr_in *)paddr->addr)->sin_addr;
00355           log_message("init_pcap:    with address: ", inet_ntoa(interface_addr));
00356 
00357           if(interface_addr.s_addr == addr.s_addr) {
00358             pcap = pcap_open_live(interfaces->name, UIP_BUFSIZE, 0, -1, error);
00359             if(pcap == NULL) {
00360               error_exit(error);
00361             }
00362 #ifdef UIP_FALLBACK_INTERFACE
00363                         log_message("init_pcap:      Opened as primary interface","");
00364 #endif
00365 //          pcap_setdirection(PCAP_D_IN);  //Not implemented in windows yet?
00366                         set_ethaddr(addr);
00367 
00368 #ifdef UIP_FALLBACK_INTERFACE
00369           }
00370           if (pfall && pcap) return;
00371           if(interface_addr.s_addr == addrfall.s_addr) {
00372             pfall = pcap_open_live(interfaces->name, UIP_BUFSIZE, 0, -1, error);
00373             if(pfall == NULL) {
00374               error_exit(error);
00375             }
00376                         log_message("init_pcap:      Opened as fallback interface","");
00377                         if (pcap) return;
00378               }
00379 #else
00380             return;
00381                   }
00382 #endif
00383 
00384 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00385 
00386         } else if(paddr->addr != NULL && paddr->addr->sa_family == AF_INET6) {
00387                   struct in6_addr interface_addr;
00388           interface_addr = ((struct sockaddr_in6 *)paddr->addr)->sin6_addr;
00389 
00390                   sprint_ip6addr(interface_addr, addr6str);
00391           log_message("init_pcap:    with ipv6 address: ", addr6str);
00392 
00393                   if (issame_ip6addr(interface_addr, addr6)) {
00394             pcap = pcap_open_live(interfaces->name, UIP_BUFSIZE, 0, -1, error);
00395             if(pcap == NULL) {
00396               error_exit(error);
00397             }
00398 #ifdef UIP_FALLBACK_INTERFACE
00399                         log_message("init_pcap:      Opened as primary interface","");
00400 #endif
00401             set_ethaddr6(addr6);
00402 //          pcap_setdirection(PCAP_D_IN);  //Not implemented in windows yet?
00403 #ifdef UIP_FALLBACK_INTERFACE
00404           }
00405           if (pfall && pcap) return;  //exit when we have both interfaces
00406 
00407                   if (issame_ip6addr(interface_addr, addrfall6)) {
00408             pfall = pcap_open_live(interfaces->name, UIP_BUFSIZE, 0, -1, error);
00409             if(pfall == NULL) {
00410               error_exit(error);
00411             }
00412                         log_message("init_pcap:      Opened as fallback interface","");
00413                         if (pcap) return;
00414               }
00415 #else
00416             return;
00417                   }
00418 #endif
00419 #endif /* UIP_CONF_IPV6 */
00420                 }
00421       }
00422     }
00423     interfaces = interfaces->next;
00424 
00425   }
00426 
00427   if(interfaces == NULL) {
00428     error_exit("no interface found with specified ip address\n");
00429   }
00430 }
00431 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00432 void
00433 wpcap_init(void)
00434 {
00435   struct in_addr addr;
00436   addr.s_addr = INADDR_NONE;  //255.255.255.255
00437 #ifdef UIP_FALLBACK_INTERFACE
00438   addrfall.s_addr = INADDR_NONE;
00439 #endif
00440 
00441   /* Pick up possible ip addresses from command line */
00442 #ifdef __CYGWIN__
00443   if ((*__argv)[1]) {
00444     addr.s_addr = inet_addr((*__argv)[1]);
00445 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00446     uiplib_ipaddrconv((*__argv)[1],(uip_ipaddr_t*) &addr6.s6_addr);
00447 #endif
00448 #ifdef UIP_FALLBACK_INTERFACE
00449     if ((*__argv)[2]) {
00450       addrfall.s_addr = inet_addr((*__argv)[2]);
00451 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00452       uiplib_ipaddrconv((*__argv)[2],(uip_ipaddr_t*) &addrfall6.s6_addr);
00453 #endif
00454     }
00455 #endif
00456   }
00457 
00458 #else /* __CYGWIN__ */
00459 /* VC++ build on win32 platform. Currently the platform has no ipv6 support */
00460   addr.s_addr = inet_addr(__argv[1]);
00461 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00462   if((__argv)[1])
00463   uiplib_ipaddrconv((__argv)[1],(uip_ipaddr_t*) &addr6.s6_addr);
00464 #endif
00465 #ifdef UIP_FALLBACK_INTERFACE
00466   addrfall.s_addr = inet_addr(__argv[2]);
00467 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00468   if((__argv)[2])
00469   uiplib_ipaddrconv((__argv)[2],(uip_ipaddr_t*) &addrfall6.s6_addr);
00470 #endif
00471 #endif
00472 #endif /* __CYGWIN__ */
00473 
00474 #if DEBUG
00475   log_message("wpcap_init:Passed ipv4 ", inet_ntoa(addr));
00476   sprint_ip6addr(addr6, addr6str);
00477   log_message("wpcap_init:Passed ipv6 ", addr6str);
00478 #ifdef UIP_FALLBACK_INTERFACE
00479   log_message("wpcap_init:Passed fallback ipv4 ", inet_ntoa(addrfall));
00480   sprint_ip6addr(addrfall6, addr6str);
00481   log_message("wpcap_init:Passed fallback ipv6 ", addr6str);
00482 #endif
00483 #endif
00484 
00485   /* Use build defaults if not enough addresses passed */
00486 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00487 
00488 #ifdef UIP_FALLBACK_INTERFACE
00489   if(addrfall.s_addr == INADDR_NONE) {
00490         if(iszero_ip6addr(addrfall6)) {
00491 #ifdef WPCAP_WPCAP_FALLBACK_ADDRESS
00492       addrfall.s_addr = inet_addr(WPCAP_FALLBACK_ADDRESS);
00493 //        if(addrfall.s_addr == INADDR_NONE) {  //use ipv6 if contiki-conf.h override
00494         uiplib_ipaddrconv(WPCAP_FALLBACK_ADDRESS,(uip_ipaddr_t*) &addrfall6.s6_addr);
00495 //        }
00496 #else
00497 //    addrfall.s_addr = inet_addr("10.2.10.10");
00498       uiplib_ipaddrconv("bbbb::1",(uip_ipaddr_t*) &addrfall6.s6_addr);
00499 #endif
00500     }
00501   }
00502 #endif
00503 
00504   if(addr.s_addr == INADDR_NONE) {
00505         if(iszero_ip6addr(addr6)) {
00506 #ifdef WPCAP_INTERFACE_ADDRESS
00507       addr.s_addr = inet_addr(WPCAP_INTERFACE_ADDRESS);
00508 //        if(addr.s_addr == INADDR_NONE) {
00509         uiplib_ipaddrconv(WPCAP_INTERFACE_ADDRESS,(uip_ipaddr_t*) &addr6.s6_addr);
00510 //        }
00511 #else
00512       addr.s_addr = inet_addr("10.10.10.10");   //prefer ipv4 default for legacy compatibility
00513 //    uiplib_ipaddrconv("aaaa::1",(uip_ipaddr_t*) &addr6.s6_addr);
00514 #endif
00515 
00516 #ifdef UIP_FALLBACK_INTERFACE
00517       log_message("usage: <program> <ip addr of interface> <ip addr of fallback>\n","");
00518           if(addr.s_addr != INADDR_NONE) {
00519                   log_message("-->I'll try interface address ", inet_ntoa(addr));
00520           } else {
00521             sprint_ip6addr(addr6, addr6str);
00522             log_message("-->I'll try interface address ", addr6str);
00523           }
00524           if(addrfall.s_addr != INADDR_NONE) {
00525                   log_message("-->      and fallback address ", inet_ntoa(addrfall));
00526           } else {
00527             sprint_ip6addr(addrfall6, addr6str);
00528             log_message("-->      and fallback address ", addr6str);
00529           }
00530 #else
00531       if(addr.s_addr != INADDR_NONE) {
00532         log_message("usage: <program> <ip addr of ethernet card to share>\n-->I'll try guessing ", inet_ntoa(addr));
00533           } else {
00534             sprint_ip6addr(addr6, addr6str);
00535             log_message("usage: <program> <ip addr of ethernet card to share>\n-->I'll try guessing ", addr6str);
00536           }
00537 #endif
00538     }
00539   }
00540 #else /* ip4 build */
00541   if(addr.s_addr == INADDR_NONE) {
00542 #ifdef WPCAP_INTERFACE_ADDRESS
00543     addr.s_addr = inet_addr(WPCAP_INTERFACE_ADDRESS);
00544 #else
00545     addr.s_addr = inet_addr("10.10.10.10");
00546 #endif
00547     log_message("usage: <program> <ip addr of ethernet card to share>\n-->I'll try guessing ", inet_ntoa(addr));
00548   }
00549 #endif /* UIP_CONF_IPV6 */
00550 
00551 #if DEBUG
00552   log_message("wpcap_init:Using ipv4 ", inet_ntoa(addr));
00553   sprint_ip6addr(addr6, addr6str);
00554   log_message("wpcap_init:Using ipv6 ", addr6str);
00555 #ifdef UIP_FALLBACK_INTERFACE
00556   log_message("wpcap_init:Using fallback ipv4 ", inet_ntoa(addrfall));
00557   sprint_ip6addr(addrfall6, addr6str);
00558   log_message("wpcap_init:Using fallback ipv6 ", addr6str);
00559 #endif
00560 #endif
00561 
00562  //   log_message("wpcap_init:cmdline address: ", inet_ntoa(addr));
00563 
00564 
00565   wpcap = LoadLibrary("wpcap.dll");
00566   pcap_findalldevs = (int (*)(struct pcap_if **, char *))
00567                      GetProcAddress(wpcap, "pcap_findalldevs");
00568   pcap_open_live   = (struct pcap *(*)(char *, int, int, int, char *))
00569                      GetProcAddress(wpcap, "pcap_open_live");
00570   pcap_next_ex     = (int (*)(struct pcap *, struct pcap_pkthdr **, unsigned char **))
00571                      GetProcAddress(wpcap, "pcap_next_ex");
00572   pcap_sendpacket  = (int (*)(struct pcap *, unsigned char *, int))
00573                      GetProcAddress(wpcap, "pcap_sendpacket");
00574 
00575   if(pcap_findalldevs == NULL || pcap_open_live  == NULL ||
00576      pcap_next_ex     == NULL || pcap_sendpacket == NULL) {
00577     error_exit("error on access to winpcap library\n");
00578   }
00579 
00580     init_pcap(addr);
00581 
00582 }
00583 
00584 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00585 u16_t
00586 wpcap_poll(void)
00587 {
00588   struct pcap_pkthdr *packet_header;
00589   unsigned char *packet;
00590 
00591   switch(pcap_next_ex(pcap, &packet_header, &packet)) {
00592   case -1:
00593     error_exit("error on poll\n");
00594   case 0:
00595     return 0;
00596   }
00597 
00598 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00599 /* Since pcap_setdirection(PCAP_D_IN) is not implemented in winpcap all outgoing packets
00600  * will be echoed back. The stack will ignore any packets not addressed to it, but initial
00601  * ipv6 neighbor solicitations are addressed to everyone and the echoed NS sent on startup
00602  * would be processed as a conflicting NS race which would cause a stack shutdown.
00603  * So discard all packets with our source address (packet starts destaddr, srcaddr, ...)
00604  *
00605  */
00606   int i;
00607   for (i=0;i<UIP_LLADDR_LEN;i++) if (*(packet+UIP_LLADDR_LEN+i)!=uip_lladdr.addr[i]) break;
00608   if (i==UIP_LLADDR_LEN) {
00609     PRINTF("SIN: Discarding echoed packet\n");
00610     return 0;
00611   }
00612   
00613 /* To implement multihop, ignore packets to us from specified source macs
00614  */
00615 //  printf("ethtype=%x %x",*(packet+2*UIP_LLADDR_LEN),*(packet+2*UIP_LLADDR_LEN+1));
00616 // printf("hopcount=%u",*(packet+21));
00617 #if 0
00618   if (0
00619 //   || (*(packet+11) ==0x1)   //20 ignores router
00620 //  || (*(packet+11) ==0x10)
00621     || (*(packet+11) ==0x20)  //router ignores 20
00622   ) {
00623    printf("i%x",*(packet+11));
00624     return 0;
00625   }
00626 /* If we are not the recipient, ignore packets from other RPL nodes */
00627   if (0
00628     || (*(packet+5) !=0x1)   //router
00629 //  || (*(packet+11) ==0x10)
00630  //   || (*(packet+11) ==0x20)  //router ignores 20
00631   ) {
00632    printf("r%x",*(packet+11));
00633     return 0;
00634   }
00635 #endif
00636 
00637 #endif /* UIP_CONF_IPV6 */
00638 
00639   if(packet_header->caplen > UIP_BUFSIZE) {
00640     return 0;
00641   }
00642 //  PRINTF("SIN: %lu\n", packet_header->caplen);
00643   CopyMemory(uip_buf, packet, packet_header->caplen);
00644   return (u16_t)packet_header->caplen;
00645 
00646 }
00647 
00648 #ifdef UIP_FALLBACK_INTERFACE
00649 u16_t
00650 wfall_poll(void)
00651 {
00652   struct pcap_pkthdr *packet_header;
00653   unsigned char *packet;
00654 
00655   switch(pcap_next_ex(pfall, &packet_header, &packet)) {
00656   case -1:
00657     error_exit("error on fallback poll\n");
00658   case 0:
00659     return 0;
00660   }
00661 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00662 /* Since pcap_setdirection(PCAP_D_IN) is not implemented in winpcap all outgoing packets
00663  * will be echoed back. The stack will ignore any packets not addressed to it, but initial
00664  * ipv6 neighbor solicitations are addressed to everyone and the echoed NS sent on startup
00665  * would be processed as a conflicting NS race which would cause a stack shutdown.
00666  * So discard all packets with our source address (packet starts destaddr, srcaddr, ...)
00667  *
00668  */
00669   int i;
00670   for (i=0;i<UIP_LLADDR_LEN;i++) if (*(packet+UIP_LLADDR_LEN+i)!=uip_lladdr.addr[i]) break;
00671   if (i==UIP_LLADDR_LEN) {
00672     PRINTF("Discarding echoed packet\n");
00673     return 0;
00674   }
00675 #endif /* UIP_CONF_IPV6 */
00676 
00677   if(packet_header->caplen > UIP_BUFSIZE) {
00678     return 0;
00679   }
00680   PRINTF("FIN: %lu\n", packet_header->caplen);
00681   CopyMemory(uip_buf, packet, packet_header->caplen);
00682   return (u16_t)packet_header->caplen;
00683 
00684 }
00685 
00686 #endif
00687 
00688 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00689 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00690 u8_t
00691 wpcap_send(uip_lladdr_t *lladdr)
00692 {
00693   if(lladdr == NULL) {
00694 /* the dest must be multicast*/
00695     (&BUF->dest)->addr[0] = 0x33;
00696     (&BUF->dest)->addr[1] = 0x33;
00697     (&BUF->dest)->addr[2] = IPBUF->destipaddr.u8[12];
00698     (&BUF->dest)->addr[3] = IPBUF->destipaddr.u8[13];
00699     (&BUF->dest)->addr[4] = IPBUF->destipaddr.u8[14];
00700     (&BUF->dest)->addr[5] = IPBUF->destipaddr.u8[15];
00701   } else {
00702    //when fallback used this gets ptr to lladdr of all zeroes on forwarded packets, turn them into multicast(?)
00703     if ((lladdr->addr[0]==0)&&(lladdr->addr[1]==0)&&(lladdr->addr[2]==0)&&(lladdr->addr[3]==0)&&(lladdr->addr[4]==0)&&(lladdr->addr[5]==0)) {
00704      (&BUF->dest)->addr[0] = 0x33;
00705      (&BUF->dest)->addr[1] = 0x33;
00706      (&BUF->dest)->addr[2] = IPBUF->destipaddr.u8[12];
00707      (&BUF->dest)->addr[3] = IPBUF->destipaddr.u8[13];
00708      (&BUF->dest)->addr[4] = IPBUF->destipaddr.u8[14];
00709      (&BUF->dest)->addr[5] = IPBUF->destipaddr.u8[15];
00710     } else {
00711       memcpy(&BUF->dest, lladdr, UIP_LLADDR_LEN);
00712     }
00713   }
00714   memcpy(&BUF->src, &uip_lladdr, UIP_LLADDR_LEN);
00715   PRINTF("SUT: %u\n", uip_len);
00716   PRINTF("Src= %02x %02x %02x %02x %02x %02x",(&BUF->src)->addr[0],(&BUF->src)->addr[1],(&BUF->src)->addr[2],(&BUF->src)->addr[3],(&BUF->src)->addr[4],(&BUF->src)->addr[5]);
00717   PRINTF("  Dst= %02x %02x %02x %02x %02x %02x",(&BUF->dest)->addr[0],(&BUF->dest)->addr[1],(&BUF->dest)->addr[2],(&BUF->dest)->addr[3],(&BUF->dest)->addr[4],(&BUF->dest)->addr[5]);
00718   PRINTF("  Type=%04x\n",BUF->type);
00719   BUF->type = UIP_HTONS(UIP_ETHTYPE_IPV6);
00720   uip_len += sizeof(struct uip_eth_hdr);
00721   if(pcap_sendpacket(pcap, uip_buf, uip_len) == -1) {
00722     error_exit("error on send\n");
00723   }
00724 return 0;
00725 }
00726 #ifdef UIP_FALLBACK_INTERFACE
00727 u8_t
00728 wfall_send(uip_lladdr_t *lladdr)
00729 {
00730   if(lladdr == NULL) {
00731 /* the dest must be multicast*/
00732     (&BUF->dest)->addr[0] = 0x33;
00733     (&BUF->dest)->addr[1] = 0x33;
00734     (&BUF->dest)->addr[2] = IPBUF->destipaddr.u8[12];
00735     (&BUF->dest)->addr[3] = IPBUF->destipaddr.u8[13];
00736     (&BUF->dest)->addr[4] = IPBUF->destipaddr.u8[14];
00737     (&BUF->dest)->addr[5] = IPBUF->destipaddr.u8[15];
00738   } else {
00739     memcpy(&BUF->dest, lladdr, UIP_LLADDR_LEN);
00740   }
00741   memcpy(&BUF->src, &uip_lladdr, UIP_LLADDR_LEN);
00742   PRINTF("FUT: %u\n", uip_len);
00743   PRINTF("Srcf= %02x %02x %02x %02x %02x %02x",(&BUF->src)->addr[0],(&BUF->src)->addr[1],(&BUF->src)->addr[2],(&BUF->src)->addr[3],(&BUF->src)->addr[4],(&BUF->src)->addr[5]);
00744   PRINTF("  Dstf= %02x %02x %02x %02x %02x %02x",(&BUF->dest)->addr[0],(&BUF->dest)->addr[1],(&BUF->dest)->addr[2],(&BUF->dest)->addr[3],(&BUF->dest)->addr[4],(&BUF->dest)->addr[5]);
00745   PRINTF("  Typef=%04x\n",BUF->type);
00746   BUF->type = UIP_HTONS(UIP_ETHTYPE_IPV6);
00747   uip_len += sizeof(struct uip_eth_hdr);
00748   if(pcap_sendpacket(pfall, uip_buf, uip_len) == -1) {
00749     error_exit("error on fallback send\n");
00750   }
00751 return 0;
00752 }
00753 #endif
00754 #else /* UIP_CONF_IPV6 */

00756 wpcap_send(void)
00757 {
00758   /*  if(rand() % 1000 > 900) {
00759     printf("Drop\n");
00760     return;
00761   } else {
00762     printf("Send\n");
00763     }*/
00764 
00765   if(pcap_sendpacket(pcap, uip_buf, uip_len) == -1) {
00766     error_exit("error on send\n");
00767   }
00768 }
00769 #endif /* UIP_CONF_IPV6 */
00770 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00771 void
00772 wpcap_exit(void)
00773 {
00774   FreeLibrary(wpcap);
00775 }
